Description: THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE BLUE LAKE RANCHERIA IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE EXPOSURE TO DIESEL EMISSIONS IN THE RANCHERIA. REPLACEMENT OF 1992 CLASS 8 FIRE ENGINE WITH A NEW AND MORE EFFICIENT FIRE ENGINE HAVING TIER 4 ENGINE.    THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $78,562.  PREAWARD COSTS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BACK TO 8/1/19.  SEE TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE MORONGO BAND OF MISSION INDIANS IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE EXPOSURE TO DIESEL EMISSIONS. THIS PROJECT WILL REPLACE TWO SCHOOL BUSES AND TWO BACKHOES WITH NEWER MODEL YEAR VEHICLES.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $283,841.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE CITY OF PHOENIX IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN PHOENIX, ARIZONA. THE CITY OF PHOENIX WILL REPLACE AT LEAST 10 CLASS 8 DIESEL REFUSE HAULERS WITH MODEL YEAR 2019, OR NEWER CLASS 8 COMPRESS NATURAL GAS (CNG) REFUSE TRUCKS. THESE TRUCKS WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES.   THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES PARTIAL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,000,000.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE SOUTH COAST AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT DISTRICT (SCAQMD) IN ITS EFFORTS TO REPLACE 2013 OR NEWER CLASS 8 DIESEL TRUCKS WITH 2019 OR NEWER TRUCKS POWERED BY COMPRESSED NATURAL GAS ENGINES CERTIFIED TO MEET THE MOST STRINGENT OPTIONAL LOW NITROGEN OXIDE EMISSION STANDARD OF 0.02 G/BHP-HR.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES PARTIAL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $2,289,581.  FUTURE FUNDING IS CONTINGENT UPON FUTURE FEDERAL APPROPRIATIONS.  FINAL PROJECT COSTS, INCLUDING COST-SHARE AMOUNTS, WILL BE ADJUSTED BASED ON THE AMOUNT OF ASSISTANCE ULTIMATELY AWARDED BY EPA AND DOCUMENTED IN THE FINAL ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE GUAM POWER AUTHORITY IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN GUAM. THE GUAM POWER AUTHORITY, THROUGH REPLACING OUTDATED DIESEL ENGINES, WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.

ACTIVITIES:THE BUCKET TRUCK THAT WILL BE REPLACED IS A 1998 40-FOOT HIGH RANGER KENWORTH BUCKET TRUCK LICENSE PLATE NUMBER 3015 THAT  HAS  A  MILEAGE  OF MORE  THAN  300,000  MILES. WITH  THE  GIVEN  MILEAGE  AND  AGE  OF TRUCK3015, THE AVERAGE MILES PER DAY IS 30. GUAM POWER AUTHORITY WILL USE THE FUNDING TO PURCHASE A VIATEC SMARTPTO (POWER TAKE OFF) WHICH IS MANUFACTURED BY TEREX UTILITIES AND PROCURE A HYBRID BUCKET TRUCK. THE VIATEC SMART PTO REDUCES IDLING, MINIMIZES NOISE BY UTILIZING STORED PLUG IN ELECTRIC  POWER TO OPERATE THE EQUIPMENT BUT MOST IMPORTANTLY HAS LESS FUEL CONSUMPTION AND LOWER AIR EMISSIONS.GPA IS VERY FAMILIAR WITH THE TEREX CORPORATION, FOR THEY ARE A GLOBAL MANUFACTURER OF AERIAL WORK PLATFORMS AND MATERIALS PROCESSING MACHINERY. TO REPLACE 1 DIESEL UTILITY AERIAL LIFT TRUCK WITH HYBRID UTILITY AERIAL LIFT TRUCK.SUBRECIPIENT:OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES ARE PHOTOS OF SCRAPPED OLD DIESEL TRUCK AND PHOTOS OF THE NEW HYBRID BUCKET TRUCK. THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS REDUCED DIESEL EMISSIONS THAT WILL BENEFIT THE GUAM COMMUNITY.

DESCRIPTION:
DIESEL EMISSION REDUCTIONS ON TRIBAL LANDS THROUGH THE DECOMMISSIONING AND REPLACEMENT OF OLDER, SHORT-HAUL, HEAVY DUTY SERVICE VEHICLES, WITH NEW LOWER-EMISSION/HIGHER EFFICIENCY MODELS.

TWO HEAVY-DUTY MUNICIPAL FLEET VEHICLES; A HAULER/MOVING TRUCK AND WATER TANKER, WILL BE REPLACED WITH NEWER MODELS OF SIMILAR PURPOSE OUTFITTED WITH DIESEL EMISSION AND OTHER POLLUTANT REDUCTION TECHNOLOGIES.

SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

THESE REPLACEMENTS WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO MES ON BEHALF OF MDOT MPA. MDOT MPA HELPS MAINTAIN INFRASTRUCTURE TO SUPPORT THE GREATER PORT OF BALTIMORE, WHICH IS A MIX OF PUBLIC AND PRIVATE MARINE TERMINALS AND MARITIME BUSINESSES.IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS IN BALTIMORE, MD. REPLACING DIESEL TRUCKS AND CARGO HANDLING EQUIPMENT SERVING THE PORT WITH NEW, CLEANER MODELS WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS, POLLUTANTS THAT CONTRIBUTE TO ADVERSE HEALTH IMPACTS SUCH AS RESPIRATORY AND CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASE. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE THE CITIZENS OF BALTIMORE.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO LEONARDO ACADEMY INC. TO PROMOTE THE REDUCTION OF DIESEL EMISSIONS IN ELIZABETH, NJ, AND RAISE AWARENESS ABOUT THE BENEFITS OF DIESEL EMISSION REDUCTION PROJECTS AMONG THE PUBLIC AND COMPANIES THAT OWN OR OPERATE DIESEL FLEETS. 
ACTIVITIES:
THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON THE REPLACEMENT OF DIESEL TERMINAL TRACTORS WITH ZERO-EMISSION ELECTRIC TRACTORS, AND THE PURCHASE OF FAST OFFBOARD CHARGING CABINETS TO PROVIDE A CHARGING POINT FOR THE ELECTRIC TERMINAL TRACTORS. 
OUTCOMES:
REPLACING DIESEL TRACTORS WITH ELECTRIC TRACTORS IS EXPECTED TO IMPROVE LOCAL AIR QUALITY BY REDUCING EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER (PM) AND OTHER POLLUTANTS, SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES (NOX), HYDROCARBONS (HC), AND CARBON MONOXIDE (CO).  MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC WHO LIVE AND WORK NEAR ELIZABETH NJ ARE EXPECTED TO BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT BY EXPERIENCING IMPROVED LOCAL AIR QUALITY AS A RESULT OF POLLUTANT EMISSIONS REDUCTION. APM TERMINAL, AS THE PROJECT PARTNER AND DIESEL VEHICLE FLEET OWNER, WILL COMPLETE THE PURCHASE OF THE ELECTRIC TRACTORS AND CHARGING CABINETS CONSISTENT WITH ELIGIBILITY AND PROJECT REQUIREMENTS. 
SUBRECIPIENT:

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO NEW YORK CITY AND LOWER HUDSON VALLEY CLEAN CITIES REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AT THE HUNTS POINT MARKET IN THE BRONX, NY THROUGH THE REPLACEMENT OF DIESEL TRANSPORT REFRIGERATION UNITS (TRUS) WITH ELECTRIC MODELS. ACTIVITIES:THIS AGREEMENT WILL FUND 19 ELECTRIC-POWERED TRANSPORT REFRIGERATION UNITS AND ASSOCIATED ELECTRIC INFRASTRUCTURE INSTALLATION AT THE HUNTS POINT PRODUCE MARKET IN THE BRONX, NEW YORK. THE ELECTRIFIED UNITS WILL REPLACE DIESEL POWERED UNITS. THE BENEFICIARIES WILL BE THE FLEET PARTNERS (NATHEL AND NATHEL AND D'ARRIGO BROS.), WHICH WILL RECEIVE ELECTRIFIED TRUS AND ELECTRIFIED PARKING SPACES AT THEIR HUNTS POINT PRODUCE MARKET FACILITIES. THE AGREEMENT WILL ALSO FUND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND OUTREACH ACTIVITIES TO INCREASE AWARENESS ABOUT THE BENEFITS OF TRANSITIONING TO ZERO-EMISSIONS VEHICLES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE INSTALLATION OF 19 ELECTRIC-POWERED TRANSPORT REFRIGERATION UNITS AND INSTALLATION OF ELECTRICAL INFRASTRUCTURE, INCLUDING THE ELECTRIFIED PARKING SPACES TO ALLOW FOR THE UNITS TO BE PLUGGED IN WHILE AT THE WAREHOUSES AT HUNTS POINT PRODUCE MARKET; DEVELOPMENT OF MATERIALS AND OUTREACH TO RAISE AWARENESS AMONG COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND TRUCKING FLEETS OF THE ECONOMIC AND ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF TRANSITIONING TO ZERO EMISSIONS TRANSPORT REFRIGERATION UNITS. OUTCOMES INCLUDE A REDUCTION IN ANNUAL EMISSIONS OF 28 TONS OF FINE PARTICULATE MATTER AND 31 TONS OF NOX. THESE EMISSION REDUCTIONS ARE EXTENDED OVER THE LONG TERM AS WELL BY EXPANDING THE LIFETIME OF TRANSPORT REFRIGERATION UNITS BY 10 YEARS. OTHER OUTCOMES INCLUDE DECREASED PUBLIC HEALTH RISK FROM AIR POLLUTION AND ACCELERATED MARKET ACCEPTANCE OF ZERO EMISSIONS TECHNOLOGY.

DESCRIPTION:
THE SWINOMISH INDIAN TRIBAL COMMUNITY (SITC) WILL REPLACE ONE (1) TIER 0, ONE (1) TIER 1 AND SIX (6) TIER 2 MARINE DIESEL ENGINES WITH NEW, LOW-EMISSION TIER 3 MARINE ENGINES.  ALL ENGINES ARE PROPULSION ENGINES ON (7) SEVEN TRIBAL FISHING VESSELS.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO REPLACE OLDER, DIRTIER ENGINES WITH CLEANER ENGINES WHICH WOULD SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS.  
ACTIVITIES:
THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE:  PROJECT STAFFING AND PLANNING; TO MEASURE PM2.5 CONCENTRATIONS AT THE FISHING DOCKS, TO SOLICIT BIDS AND PROCUREMENT OF BOAT REPOWER, INSTALLATION OF NEW ENGINES, CREATE A MAINTENANCE AND EMISSION REDUCTION PLAN, AND TO TRACK AND REPORT SUSTAINABILITY.

DESCRIPTION:
THE QUINAULT INDIAN NATION REPOWER PROJECT WILL REPLACE TWO TIER 0 DIESEL (MAIN) MARINE ENGINES AND ONE TIER 0 DIESEL (AUXILIARY) MARINE ENGINE ON TWO VESSELS WITH CURRENT EPA STANDARD MARINE TIER 3 DIESEL ENGINES. 
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO REPLACE OLDER, DIRTIER ENGINES WITH CLEANER ENGINES WHICH WOULD SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS. 
THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE:  DEVELOPING AN RFP ADVERTISEMENT FOR QUALIFIED MARINE CONSULTANT AND PROJECT COORDINATOR, PROVIDE OUTREACH AND EDUCATION.  THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES WILL BE THREE NEW MARINE ENGINE REPLACEMENTS ON TWO TRIBALLY OWNED FISHING VESSELS WITH ANTICIPATED ANNUAL AND LIFETIME DIESEL EMISSION REDUCTIONS IN NOX, PM2.5, HC, CO, AND CO2. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES WILL BE THE TRIBAL VESSEL OWNERS AND IN GENERAL THE QIN TRIBAL COMMUNITY. 
ACTIVITIES:
THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE:  PROJECT STAFFING, PROJECT PLANNING; BIDDING AND PROCUREMENT, PROJECT INSTALLATION: PROJECT MAINTENANCE AND EMISSION REDUCTION PLANNING; AND PROJECT SUSTAINABILITY AND REPORTING.  
OUTCOMES:
THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE:  DEVELOPING AN RFP ADVERTISEMENT FOR QUALIFIED MARINE CONSULTANT AND PROJECT COORDINATOR, PROVIDE OUTREACH AND EDUCATION.  THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES WILL BE THREE NEW MARINE ENGINE REPLACEMENTS ON TWO TRIBALLY OWNED FISHING VESSELS WITH ANTICIPATED ANNUAL AND LIFETIME DIESEL EMISSION REDUCTIONS IN NOX, PM2.5, HC, CO, AND CO2.    THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES WILL BE THE TRIBAL VESSEL OWNERS AND IN GENERAL THE QIN TRIBAL COMMUNITY.

DESCRIPTION:
THE LUMMI REPOWER PROJECT WILL REPOWER FOUR (4) DIESEL ENGINES ON FOUR (4) MARINE VESSELS WITH FOUR (4) NEW LOW-EMISSION DIESEL ENGINES.  THE VESSELS ARE USED THROUGHOUT THE YEAR IN TRIBAL FISHERIES TARGETING SALMON, HALIBUT, CRAB, AND SHRIMP.  THE MAIN GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO GIVE OUR FISHERS THE OPPOR6TUNITY TO UPGRADE THEIR CURRENT DIESEL ENGINES WITH NEW LOW-EMISSION DIESEL ENGINES WHICH WILL FURTHER PROTECT THE ENVIRONMENT AND INCREASE FUEL EFFICIENCY.
ACTIVITIES:
ANTICIPATED ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE:  IDENTIFY STAFF ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES ASSIGNED TO THE PROJECT; PROJECT PLANNING TO INCLUDE IDENTIFICATION AND DOCUMENTATION OF EACH VESSEL  IN THE PROJECT; WORK WITH VESSEL OWNERS TO OBTAIN BIDS FROM MARINE ENGINE PROVIDERS FOR REPOWERING VESSELS; ONCE VENDOR IS SELECTED, WORK WITH ENGINE SUPPLIER AND VESSEL OWNERS TO DEVELOP AN INSTALLATION SCHEDULE, DOCUMENT THE DECOMMISSIONING OF THE OLD ENGINES WHICH WILL INCLUDE CERTIFICATE OF DESTRUCTION AND PHOTOGRAPH; DEVELOP A MAINTENANCE PLAN FOR EACH NEW ENGINE INSTALLED, AND COMPILE THE INFORMATION NECESSARY TO PREPARE REQUIRED REPORTING REPORTS TO EPA. 
OUTCOMES:
ANTICIPATED OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES INCLUDE:  WORK WITH IDENTIFIED VESSEL OWNERS TO ENSURE ENGINE REPLACEMENT MEET THE QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS OF THE GRANT.  ANTICIPATE REDUCTION IN ACUTE RESPIRATORY AND PULMONARY HEALTH RISKS TO VESSEL OPERATIONS AND  TO TRIBAL FISHERS AND THEIR COMMUNITY.  CONTINUE MONITORING ON THE REDUCTION IN AIRSHED OF TOTAL SUSPENDED PARTICLES AND REDUCTION IN PM10; AND WILL CONTINUE TO REPORT AND MONITOR COST SAVINGS TO VESSEL OWNERS FOR REDUCED FUEL COSTS.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:
THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF DEERING WILL REPLACE TWO (2) TIER 1 DIESEL GEN-SETS, WITH TWO (2) MORE EFFICIENT TIER 3 DIESEL GEN-SET WITH UPGRADE TO THE EASYGEN CONTROLLERS.  THE CITY OF DEERING CURRENTLY OWNS AND OPERATES THE IPNATCHIAQ ELECTRIC COMPANY (IEC) WHICH OPERATES THE POWER PLANT AND ELECTRIC DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM AND PROVIDES ELECTRIC UTILITY SERVICE TO THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY OF DEERING, ALASKA.  THEY WILL OWN AND OPERATE THE PROPOSED NEW GEN-SETS WHICH WILL ALSO INTERFACE  WITH SYSTEM CONTROLS  RELATED TO THE WIND-SOLAR BATTER-DIESEL HYBRID SYSTEM.

DISABLE THE OLD ENGINES BY DRILLING HOLE THROUGH ENGINE BLOCK AND PHOTO DOCUMENT, 6.) EXPAND DATA COLLECTION, AND 7.) COMPLETE ALL REQUIRED REPORTING AND VERIFY FUEL REDUCTIONS.  
OUTCOMES:
THE PRIMARY OUTPUTS FROM THIS PROJECT WILL BE THE REPLACEMENT OF TWO (2) DIESEL GEN-SETS WITH MORE EFFICIENT, CLEANER UNITS. THE PROJECT WILL IMPACT THREE PORT LOCATIONS IN TWO STATES AND DISPLAY THE LEADERSHIP OF IMPLEMENTING ZERO EMISSION VEHICLES IN SUPPORT OF TWO SEPARATE INDUSTRIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY REGION 4, INCLUDING HAULING AUTOMOTIVE PARTS FOR A MAJOR MANUFACTURER AND CHEMICAL/PLASTICS TRANSPORTATION. THE SPECIFIC OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT ARE EXPECTED TO INCREASE INTEREST FROM DRAYAGE AND SHORT HAUL FLEETS IN PORT AREAS, COMMUNITY DRIVEN DEMAND FOR ZERO EMISSION VEHICLES AND FLEETS IN GOODS MOVEMENT AREAS, AND ANNUAL EMISSIONS REDUCTION AS FOLLOWS:  2.141 TONS NITROGEN OXIDES, .274 TONS PARTICULAR MATTER WITH DIAMETERS LESS 2.5 MICROMETERS EMISSIONS, .325 TONS HYDROCARBON, 1.087 TONS CARBON MONOXIDE, 753.8 TONS CARBON MONOXIDE, AND 67,000 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF STATES OF SOUTH CAROLINA AND GEORGIA, THAT WILL BENEFIT FROM THE GRANT.

FORTY PRE-2007 DRAYAGE TRUCKS SERVING THE NWSA DOMESTIC CONTAINER TERMINALS WILL BE SCRAPPED AND REPLACED WITH NEWER, CLEANER DIESEL VERSIONS WITH 2015 OR NEWER ENGINES. THE TRUCKS CURRENTLY SERVE THE DOMESTIC CONTAINER TERMINALS, TOTE AND SSA-WEST SITCUM, IN TACOMA, WA, MOVING CONTAINERIZED CARGO BETWEEN TERMINALS, RAIL YARDS AND REGIONAL WAREHOUSES. REPLACING THESE 40 TRUCKS WITH NEWER, CLEANER DIESEL VERSIONS WILL REDUCE DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER EMISSIONS BY 20.5 TONS OVER THE LIFETIME OF THE PROJECT AND WILL BENEFIT NEIGHBORING COMMUNITIES THAT ARE DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED BY AIR POLLUTION DUE TO THEIR PROXIMITY TO THE PORT INDUSTRIAL COMPLEX AND THE I-5 CORRIDOR.

THIS PROJECT WILL REPLACE 67 DIESEL TRUCKS WITH NEW DIESEL TRUCKS MEETING CURRENT U.S. EPA EMISSIONS STANDARDS AS A PHASE I/PHASE II PROJECT. ELIGIBLE PROJECT ACTIVITIES TO BE ACCOMPLISHED IN EACH PHASE INCLUDE: PHASE I: TRUCK REPLACEMENTS (DIESEL TO DIESEL): SEVENTEEN (17) CLASS 8 LONG HAUL COMBINATION TRUCKS, ONE (1) CLASS 8 SHORT HAUL COMBINATION TRUCK, NINE (9) CLASS 8 LONG HAUL SINGLE UNIT TRUCKS, ONE (1) CLASS 8 SHORT HAUL SINGLE UNIT TRUCK, FOUR (4) CLASS 8 DUMPER/TENDERS, AND TWO (2) CLASS 6/7 SHORT HAUL SINGLE UNIT TRUCKS. PHASE II: TRUCK REPLACEMENTS (DIESEL TO DIESEL): FOURTEEN (14) CLASS 8 LONG HAUL COMBINATION TRUCKS, ELEVEN (11) CLASS 8 LONG HAUL SINGLE UNIT TRUCKS, SIX (6) CLASS 8 DUMPER/TENDERS, AND TWO (2) CLASS 6/7 SHORT HAUL SINGLE UNIT TRUCKS. REMOVING OLD ENGINES/VEHICLES FROM OPERATION REDUCES EXPOSURE TO TOXIC DIESEL EMISSIONS, WHICH CAN BE ESPECIALLY HARMFUL TO VULNERABLE POPULATIONS SUCH AS ELDERLY PERSONS AND CHILDREN, WHICH IS A SERIOUS CONCERN IN DETROIT AND THE SURROUNDING AREAS GIVEN HIGH RATES OF ASTHMA AND OTHER RESPIRATORY ILLNESS, CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASE, AND CANCER - ALL OF WHICH ARE LINKED WITH EXPOSURE TO DIESEL EMISSIONS. THIS PROJECT DELIVERS IMPACT IN THE DETROIT/TOLEDO/WINDSOR TRADE CORRIDOR AND WITHIN SOUTHEAST MICHIGAN. THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COMMUNITY BY ELIMINATING DIESEL POLLUTION THAT WOULD OTHERWISE BE EMITTED WITHOUT THIS PROJECT.

THE MCERI PROJECT AIMS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS IN 2021 DIESEL EMISSIONS REDUCTION ACT (DERA) PRIORITY COUNTIES ACROSS SIX MIDWEST STATES AND WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE  MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.  THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE PUBLIC AND IN PARTICULAR, THOSE WHO LIVE, WORK OR PLAY NEAR WHERE THE AFFECTED FLEET OPERATES. THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT SHOULD BENEFIT THE PUBLIC WITH CLEANER AIR AND LOWER TOXIC EMISSIONS OF DIESEL EXHAUST.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO LEONARDO ACADEMY INCORPORATED (LEONARDO ACADEMY) IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN THE COUNTIES OF BAYFIELD AND ASHLAND, WISCONSIN.  THROUGH THE EARLY REPLACEMENT OF TWO TIER 2 MARINE ENGINES WITH TIER 3 ENGINES ON THE MV BAYFIELD FERRY, LEONARDO ACADEMY WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO COALITION FOR SUSTAINABLE INITIATIVES (CFSI) IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN DETROIT, MICHIGAN AND MILWAUKEE, WISCONSIN.  UTILIZING A REBATE PROGRAM, 7 CLASS 8 HEAVY-DUTY CEMENT MIXERS, 1 HEAVY-DUTY CRANE AND 15 SCHOOL BUSES WILL BE REPLACED WITH CLEAN DIESEL OR ALTERNATIVE FUEL REPLACEMENTS TO REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO LEONARDO ACADEMY INCORPORATED (LEONARDO ACADEMY) IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN WILL COUNTY, ILLINOIS, AND THE COUNTIES OF HENNEPIN AND WASHINGTON IN MINNESOTA.  LEONARDO ACADEMY'S PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FOR THE EARLY REPLACEMENT OF FOUR NON-TIER DIESEL ENGINE CRANES WITH NEWER CRANES THAT HAVE TIER 4 DIESEL ENGINES.  THIS PROJECT WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE AMERICAN LUNG ASSOCIATION (ALA) IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN THE QUAD CITIES URBAN AREA (PRIMARILY ROCK ISLAND AND HENRY COUNTIES IN ILLINOIS). ALA'S PROJECT WILL REPLACE UP TO 5 OLDER DIESEL TRANSIT BUSES WITH NEW, ZERO-EMISSION ELECTRIC TRANSIT BUSES.  THIS PROJECT WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.  THE PROJECT WILL ALSO SUBSTANTIALLY REDUCE DIESEL FUEL USE.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE AMERICAN LUNG ASSOCIATION (ALA) IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN MULTIPLE COUNTIES IN ILLINOIS, INDIANA, AND OHIO. ALA'S PROJECT INCLUDES INSTALLATION OF 35 LOCOMOTIVE AUXILIARY POWER UNITS, REPLACEMENT OF 8 REGIONAL-HAUL FREIGHT TRUCKS, AND REPLACEMENT OF UP TO 18 WASTE HAULERS.  THESE ACTIONS WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO CONSERVE DIESEL FUEL.

THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO METRA IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN THE CHICAGO METROPOLITAN AREA (CHICAGO, DUPAGE, LAKE, KANE, LAKE, WILL COUNTIES IN ILLINOIS) BY REPLACING SEVEN OLDER PIECES OF NONROAD CONSTRUCTION EQUIPMENT WITH SEVEN NEW PIECES OF NONROAD CONSTRUCTION EQUIPMENT CERTIFIED TO MEET EPA'S TIER 4 NONROAD ENGINE EMISSIONS STANDARDS.  THE PROJECT WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER, OXIDES OF NITROGEN, VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS, CARBON MONOXIDE, AND OTHER COMBUSTION-RELATED POLLUTANTS.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE CHICAGO DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN AND AROUND THE ENGLEWOOD COMMUNITY IN CHICAGO (COOK COUNTY). BY REPLACING 6 OLDER, DIRTIER STREET SWEEPERS WITH NEW, CLEANER STREET SWEEPERS THAT RUN ON COMPRESSED NATURAL GAS AND ARE CERTIFIED TO MEET THE CALIFORNIA AIR RESOURCES BOARD'S LOW-NOX EMISSIONS STANDARDS, CDOT WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE NATIONAL SCHOOL TRANSPORTATION ASSOCIATION INC (NSTA) IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN WISCONSIN (MILWAUKEE COUNTY), ILLINOIS (COOK COUNTY), AND OHIO (CUYAHOGA COUNTY). THE PROJECT ANTICIPATES FACILITATING THE REPLACEMENT OF TWENTY-FIVE (25) DIESEL SCHOOL BUSES WITH ENGINE MODEL YEARS 2009 OR OLDER WITH TWENTY-FIVE (25) EPA AND/OR CARB CERTIFIED 2018 MODEL YEAR OR NEWER SCHOOL BUSES. WHILE THE PROJECT SEEKS FUNDING TO OFFER REBATES FOR THE REPLACEMENT OF TWENTY-FIVE (25) SCHOOL BUSES, IT IS SCALABLE AND THE NUMBER OF REPLACEMENTS CAN BE MODIFIED AS NEEDED.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE SOUTHWEST DETROIT ENVIRONMENTAL VISION (SDEV) IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN DETROIT AND SOUTHEAST MICHIGAN. THE REPLACEMENT OF 28 DIESEL TRUCKS (FIVE CLASS 8 SHORT-HAUL TRACTORS, ONE CLASS 6/7 SHORT HAUL TRACTOR, AND TWENTY-TWO LONG HAUL TRACTORS) WITH NEW DIESEL TRUCKS MEETING CURRENT U.S. EPA EMISSIONS STANDARDS WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE SOUTHWEST DETROIT ENVIRONMENTAL VISION (SDEV) IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN MICHIGAN. SPECIFICALLY, SDEV WILL REPLACE EIGHT (8) PRE-2007 CLASS 6/7 DIESEL CONSTRUCTION TRUCKS; TWO (2) POST-2007 CLASS 6/7 DIESEL CONSTRUCTION TRUCKS; ONE (1) PRE-2007 CLASS 6/7 DIESEL REFUSE HAULER (MUNICIPAL USE); EIGHT (8) POST-2007 CLASS 8 DIESEL SHORT-HAUL COMBINATION UNIT TRUCKS; FIFTEEN (15) PRE-2007 CLASS 8 DIESEL SHORT-HAUL COMBINATION TRUCKS WITH NEW TECHNOLOGY. THIS PROJECT WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE, AND HYDROCARBONS.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO SOUTH SHORE CLEAN CITIES, INC. (SSCC) IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN ILLINOIS AND INDIANA. SSCC, IN COLLABORATION WITH PROGRAM BENEFICIARIES, WILL REPLACE SIX (6) LONG HAUL COMBINATION TRUCKS WITH EMY 2019 CLEAN DIESEL, ONE (1) TIER 1 WHEEL LOADER WITH TIER 4 FINAL LOADER, TWO (2) MARINE PROPULSION ENGINES WITH CLEAN DIESEL REPLACEMENTS (TIER 0 TO TIER 3), FOUR (4) READY-MIX CONCRETE TRUCKS WITH EMY 2019 CLEAN DIESEL TRUCKS, AND REPLACE ONE (1) SHORT HAUL TRUCK AND FOUR (4) REFUSE TRUCKS WITH TRUCKS CERTIFIED TO THE CARB-LOW NOX STANDARD. THIS PROJECT WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE, AND HYDROCARBONS.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE AMERICAN LUNG ASSOCIATION (ALA) IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN ILLINOIS, INDIANA, MICHIGAN, AND OHIO. ALA WILL REPLACE SEVEN (7) LOW-NOX CNG REFUSE HAULERS FOR WASTE MANAGEMENT (WM), FOUR (4) DIESEL SHORT-HAUL VEHICLES FOR G&D INTEGRATED (G&D), AND TWENTY FIVE (25) DIESEL SHORT-HAUL TRUCKS FOR SYSCO CORPORATION (SYSCO). IN ADDITION, ALA WILL INSTALL SEVEN (7) LOCOMOTIVE AUXILARY POWER UNITS FOR CHICAGO SOUTH SHORE & SOUTH BEND RAILROAD (CSS). THIS PROJECT WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE, AND HYDROCARBONS.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE COALITION FOR SUSTAINABLE INITIATIVES (CFSI) IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE WITHIN THE STATES OF ILLINOIS, INDIANA, MICHIGAN, MINNESOTA, OHIO AND WISCONSIN.  CFSI WILL ADMINISTER A TWO-PHASE GRANT PROGRAM THROUGH A REGIONAL COLLABORATION THAT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR CLEAN DIESEL PROJECTS INVOLVING 55 COMBINATION SHORT HAUL TRUCKS, 11 CONCRETE MIXERS AND TWO DUMP TRUCKS OPERATING IN NONATTAINMENT AREAS.  THIS PROJECT WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE ENVIRONMENTAL INITIATIVE (EI) IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN MINNESOTA. SPECIFICALLY, EI WILL REPLACE 11 ON-ROAD CLASS 8 TRUCKS, TWO FRONT END LOADERS, EXCAVATORS, AND ONE STREET SWEEPER WITH 2019 - CERTIFIED TECHNOLOGY. THIS PROJECT WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS  NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.

THE ENVIRONMENTAL INITIATIVE INC. (EI) WILL REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN MINNESOTA. SPECIFICALLY, THIS PROJECT INCLUDES: REPOWERING OF THREE TIER-0 TOWBOAT PROPULSION ENGINES AND TWO AUXILIARY GENERATOR ENGINES TO EPA CERTIFIED TIER-III, AND REPLACING FOUR CLASS 8 TRUCKS, THREE FRONT-END LOADERS, ONE LOCOMOTIVE SWITCHER, AND ONE CRANE WITH TIER-4 EQUIPMENT AND ONE MATERIAL HANDLER WITH AN ELECTRIC ALTERNATIVE. THIS PROJECT WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE, AND HYDROCARBONS.

THE COALITION FOR SUSTAINABLE INITIATIVES (CFSI) WILL REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN COOK COUNTY, ILLINOIS; HENNEPIN COUNTY, MINNESOTA; FOUR COUNTIES IN INDIANA; WAYNE COUNTY, MICHIGAN, THREE COUNTIES IN OHIO; AND THREE COUNTIES IN WISCONSIN.  THE REPLACEMENT OF 19 COMBINATION SHORT HAUL TRUCKS WITH CLEAN DIESEL AND LIQUIFIED NATURAL GAS TRUCKS MODEL YEAR 2019 IN THESE NONATTAINMENT AREAS WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.

SOUTHWEST DETROIT ENVIRONMENTAL VISION (SWDEV) WILL REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN THE MICHIGAN AREA. SPECIFICALLY, THIS PROJECT INCLUDES REPLACEMENT OF 35 DIESEL TRUCKS AND ONE DIESEL CRANE. THIS PROJECT WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS SUCH NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE, AND HYDROCARBONS.

LYLE PUBLIC SCHOOL DISTRICT WILL REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN MOWER COUNTY, MINNESOTA. LYLE PUBLIC SCHOOL WILL REPLACE A MODEL YEAR 2003 SCHOOL BUS WITH A NEW CLEAN DIESEL BUS. THIS PROJECT WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.

ELKTON-PIGEON-BAY PORT LAKER SCHOOL DISTRICT WILL REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN HURON AND MACOMB COUNTIES IN MICHIGAN. ELKTON-PIGEON-BAY WILL PARTNER WITH LOCAL SCHOOL DISTRICTS TO REPLACE NINE MODEL YEARS 1996-2006 SCHOOL BUSES WITH NEW CLEAN DIESEL BUSES. THIS PROJECT WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.

THE AMERICAN LUNG ASSOCIATION WILL REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN INDIANA, ILLINOIS, AND MICHIGAN. SPECIFICALLY, THIS PROJECT INCLUDES: 1) THE PURCHASE OF 13 APUS FOR SWITCH LOCOMOTIVES OPERATING IN INDIANA; 2) THE PURCHASE OF 35 APUS FOR LOCOMOTIVES OPERATING IN INDIANA, ILLINOIS, AND MICHIGAN; AND 3) THE PURCHASE OF 4 DPFS FOR MUNICIPAL VEHICLES OPERATING IN ILLINOIS. THIS PROJECT WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE, AND HYDROCARBONS.

THE NATIONAL SCHOOL TRANSPORTATION ASSOCIATION (NSTA) WILL REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN COOK COUNTY, ILLINOIS AND DANE COUNTY, WISCONSIN.  NSTA WILL REPLACE 17 MODEL YEARS 2001-2005 DIESEL SCHOOL BUSES WITH ALTERNATIVE FUEL POWERED SCHOOL BUSES MODEL YEAR 2018 OR NEWER.  THESE REPLACEMENTS WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT TO THE WISCONSIN CLEAN CITIES ALLOWS THE GRANTEE TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE AT PORTS IN LAKE AND PORTER COUNTIES, INDIANA. THIS PROJECT INCLUDES; THE REPLACEMENT OF 12 DRAYAGE TRUCKS; AND THE REPLACEMENT OF 1 LOADER. THE PROJECT WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE, AND HYDROCARBONS.

AMERICAN LUNG ASSOCIATION (ALA) WILL REPLACE ON-ROAD DIESEL REFUSE HAULERS IN GEAUGA COUNTY, OHIO, AND DIESEL TERMINAL TRACTORS IN LUCAS COUNTY, OHIO. THE REFUSE HAULERS WILL BE REPLACED WITH COMPRESSED NATURAL GAS (CNG) VEHICLES, AND THE TERMINAL TRACTORS WILL BE REPLACED WITH ELECTRIC VEHICLES. BOTH GEAUGA AND LUCAS COUNTIES ARE IDENTIFIED ON THE DERA 2017 NATIONAL PRIORITY COUNTY LIST.  THIS PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO REDUCE 8,044 LIFETIME TONS OF TOTAL POLLUTANTS AND SAVE $2,985,000 IN ANNUAL HEALTH CARE COSTS.

THE CHICAGO DEPARTMENT OF AVIATION (CDA) WILL REPLACE DIESEL-POWERED AIRPORT GROUND SUPPORT EQUIPMENT (GSE) WITH NEW ELECTRIC GSE. THESE WILL CONSIST OF CARGO AND BAGGAGE TRACTORS. THIS PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO REDUCE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM)2.5 EMISSIONS BY 169.3 TONS, AND NOX EMISSIONS BY 327.5 TONS, OVER THE LIFETIME OF THE VEHICLES. THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT MANY PEOPLE IN CHICAGO, A COMMUNITY IN A NON-ATTAINMENT AREA FOR OZONE. ALL GSE ARE USED TO SERVICE COMMERCIAL AND CARGO AIRCRAFT AT O'HARE INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT.

THE CLEVELAND CUYAHOGA COUNTY PORT AUTHORITY (PORT OF CLEVELAND) WILL REPLACE 1940'S ERA SINGLE ENGINE TUG BOATS OPERATING IN PORTS IN NON-ATTAINMENT AREAS ALONG LAKE MICHIGAN AND THE DETROIT RIVER WITH NEW DUAL ENGINE TUG BOATS. TO FURTHER REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS, PORT OF CLEVELAND WILL USE SINGLE GENERATOR SETS AND ANTI-IDLING TECHNOLOGIES. THE PROJECT IS ESTIMATED TO ELIMINATE 12 TONS OF NITROGEN OXIDES AND .3 TONS OF PARTICULATE MATTER EMISSIONS OVER THE LIFETIME OF THE PROJECT.

THE CHICAGO TRANSIT AUTHORITY (CTA) WILL REPLACE ONE MODEL YEAR 1998 CONVENTIONAL DIESEL TRANSIT BUS WITH AN ALL-ELECTRIC ZERO EMISSION BUS WITH EN-ROUTE CHARGING CAPABILITIES. CTA WILL ACHIEVE SIGNIFICANT EMISSIONS REDUCTIONS THROUGH ADVANCED VEHICLE TECHNOLOGIES AND ALTERNATIVE FUEL SOURCES, WHICH WILL BENEFIT MANY PEOPLE IN CHICAGO, A COMMUNITY IN A NON-ATTAINMENT AREA FOR OZONE. THE HEALTH BENEFITS DUE TO REDUCTIONS IN PM EMISSIONS IS ESTIMATED TO BE $2,280,000 OVER THE LIFETIME OF THE BUS. OPERATING ONE ELECTRIC BUS IS EQUIVALENT TO REMOVING 23 CARS FROM THE ROAD, EACH YEAR.

SOUTHWEST DETROIT ENVIRONMENTAL VISION (SWDEV) WILL REPLACE 50 VEHICLES INCLUDING: CLASS 8 LONG-HAUL TRUCKS, SHORT-HAUL CLASS 8 TRUCKS, SHORT-HAUL SINGLE UNIT CLASS 6/7 DIESEL TRUCKS, DUMP TRUCKS AND CLASS 6/7 DUMPERS/TENDERS. ALL VEHICLES IMPACTED WILL OPERATE LOCALLY WITHIN THE DETROIT METROPOLITAN AREA 80% OF THE TIME, A NON-ATTAINMENT AREA FOR OZONE AND SULFUR DIOXIDE.  DIESEL EMISSION REDUCTIONS FROM THIS PROJECT WILL PROTECT METRO DETROIT RESIDENTS FROM AN ESTIMATED 59 TONS PER YEAR OF POLLUTANTS, INCLUDING: 42 TONS OF NITROGEN OXIDES, 2 TONS OF PARTICULATE MATTER, 2 TONS OF CARBON DIOXIDE, AND 13 TONS OF HYDROCARBONS.

TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS IN ITS SERVICE AREA, THE STARK AREA REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY (SARTA) WILL REPLACE DIESEL PARATRANSIT BUSES WITH NEW, ZERO-EMISSION ELECTRIC FUEL CELL PARATRANSIT VEHICLES. SARTA WILL USE ADVANCED TRANSIT VEHICLE TECHNOLOGIES AND LOCALLY-SOURCED HYDROGEN FUEL TO ELIMINATE AN ESTIMATED 7.65 LBS. OF PARTICULATE MATTER AND 1,199 LBS. OF NITROGEN OXIDES EMISSIONS OVER THE LIFETIME OF THE PROJECT.  THESE REDUCTIONS WILL BENEFIT COMMUNITIES DESIGNATED AS NON-ATTAINMENT IN STARK COUNTY, OHIO.

THE ENVIRONMENTAL INITIATIVE (EI) WILL IMPROVE AIR QUALITY AND PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH BY REDUCING DIESEL EMISSIONS BY RE-POWERING TIER-I TOWBOAT ENGINES TO EPA CERTIFIED TIER-III; AND REPLACING CLASS 8 TRUCKS, A FRONT-END LOADER, AERIAL LIFTS, AND STREET SWEEPER TO TIER IV EMISSION STANDARD.  THIS WORK WILL BE COMPLETED IN CLOSE PROXIMITY TO DIVERSE RESIDENTIAL POPULATIONS AND COMMERCIAL ACTIVITY IN ST PAUL, MINNESOTA. THE PROJECTED LIFETIME POLLUTION REDUCTIONS FROM THIS PROJECT ARE: 180.5 TONS OF NITROGEN OXIDES AND 8.7 TONS OF PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5.
